cbcrom package¶

Submodules¶

cbcrom.chebyshev module¶

Utilities for Chebyshev interpolation.

class cbcrom.chebyshev.ChebyshevApproximation[source]¶

Methods for approximating [1, 2, 3]-d functions with Chebyshev polynomials.

shape : List of length Ndim
Number of points in each dimension
low : List of length Ndim
Lower boundary of grid
high : List of length Ndim
Upper boundary of grid
Ndim : int
Number of dimensions
nodes : Ndim length list of arrays containing the nodes in each dimension.
Coordinates of the Lobatto nodes
f_grid : Array of shape shape.
Function values at the grid of Lobatto nodes.
coefficients : Array of shape shape.
Coefficients of the Chebyshev expansion.
calculate_chebyshev_coefficients()[source]¶

Calculate the coefficients in the Chebyshev expansion.

evaluate_function_at_lobatto_nodes(func, shape, low, high)[source]¶

Evaluate a function on a grid given by the Lobatto nodes.

interpolation(*args)[source]¶

Interpolate the function at a specific point.

lobatto_nodes(shape, low, high)[source]¶

Generate a list of arrays for the Lobatto nodes in each dimension.

cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_coefficient3d_list_generator(f_ijk_list, params_min, params_max)[source]¶

Generate Chebyshev coefficients to approximate the function (amp or phase) at the empirical_nodes T_i.

f_ijk_list : list of N-d arrays
Function values on the Chebyshev-Gauss-Lobatto grid.
params_min : 1d array of length 3
Minimum value of each parameter.
params_max : 1d array of length 3
Maximum value of each parameter.
coefficient_list : List of N-d numpy arrays
The chebyshev coefficients corresponding to a list of functions.
cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_interpolation(x, c_l_array, xlow, xhigh)[source]¶

Interpolate f(x) given its expansion in terms of Chebyshev polynomials T_l(x).

x : float c_l_array : 1d array Coefficients of the Chebyshev polynomials xlow : float Lower bound of the interval. xhigh : float Upper bound of the interval.

f(x) : float Function evaluated at x.

cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_interpolation2d(x, y, c_lm_array, xlow, xhigh, ylow, yhigh)[source]¶

Interpolate f(x, y) given its expansion in terms of Chebyshev polynomials T_l(x)T_m(y).

x, y : floats c_lm_array : 2d array Coefficients of the Chebyshev polynomials xlow, ylow : floats Lower bounds of the intervals. xhigh, yhigh : floats Upper bounds of the intervals.

f(x, y) : float Function evaluated at x, y.

cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_interpolation3d(x, y, z, c_lmn_array, xlow, xhigh, ylow, yhigh, zlow, zhigh)[source]¶

Interpolate f(x, y, z) given its expansion in terms of Chebyshev polynomials T_l(x)T_m(y)T_n(z).

x, y, z : floats c_lmn_array : 3d array Coefficients of the Chebyshev polynomials xlow, ylow, zlow : floats Lower bounds of the intervals. xhigh, yhigh, zhigh : floats Upper bounds of the intervals.

f(x, y, z) : float Function evaluated at x, y, z.

cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_interpolation3d_generator(coefficients, params_min, params_max)[source]¶

Generate a function of N parameters that interpolates a uniformly spaced Nd array.

coefficients : N-d numpy array
The chebyshev coefficients corresponding to a list of functions.
params_min : 1d array of length 3
Minimum value of each parameter.
params_max : 1d array of length 3
Maximum value of each parameter.

function_list : list of function(params)

cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_lobatto_nodes(Nnodes, low=-1.0, high=1.0)[source]¶

Find the Chebyshev-Lobatto nodes in the interval [low, high].

Nnodes : int
Number of nodes
low : {float, -1.0}
Lower bound of the interval.
high : {float, 1.0}
Upper bound of the invterval
cbcrom.chebyshev.chebyshev_polynomial(n, x)[source]¶

n-th order Chebyshev polynomial T_n(x) of the first kind.

n : int
Order of the polynomial >= 0.
x : float
Must by evaluated in the interval [-1, 1].
cbcrom.chebyshev.fast_chebyshev_transform(f_k)[source]¶

Compute the Chebyshev transform of f_k.

f_k : real numpy array
Function evaluated at the Chebyshev-Gauss-Lobatto nodes in interval [-1, 1].
b_n : real numpy array
Coefficients of the Chebyshev polynomials.
cbcrom.chebyshev.fast_chebyshev_transform_2d(f_ij)[source]¶

Calculate the coefficients c_lm of the Chebyshev polynomial product T_l(x)T_m(y) in the Chebyshev expansion of the function f(x, y).

f_ij : 2d array of floats
Value of the function f(x_i, y_j) at the Chebyshev-Lobatto nodes x_i, y_j.
c_lmn : 2d array of float
Coefficients of T_l(x)T_m(y).
cbcrom.chebyshev.fast_chebyshev_transform_3d(f_ijk)[source]¶

Calculate the coefficients c_lmn of the Chebyshev polynomial product T_l(x)T_m(y)T_n(z) in the Chebyshev expansion of the function f(x, y, z).

f_ijk : 3d array of floats
Value of the function f(x_i, y_j, z_k) at the Chebyshev-Lobatto nodes x_i, y_j, z_k.
c_lmn : 3d array of float
Coefficients of T_l(x)T_m(y)T_n(z).
cbcrom.chebyshev.load_chebyshev_coefficients_list(filename)[source]¶

Load a list of N-d coefficient arrays.

filename : string
hdf5 filename
coefficients_list : List of N-d numpy arrays
The chebyshev coefficients corresponding to a list of functions.
params_min : 1d array of length N
Minimum value of each parameter.
params_max : 1d array of length N
Maximum value of each parameter.
cbcrom.chebyshev.save_chebyshev_coefficients_list(filename, coefficients_list, params_min, params_max)[source]¶

Load a list of N-d coefficient arrays.

filename : string
hdf5 filename
coefficients_list : List of N-d numpy arrays
The chebyshev coefficients corresponding to a list of functions.
params_min : 1d array of length N
Minimum value of each parameter.
params_max : 1d array of length N
Maximum value of each parameter.

cbcrom.empiricalinterpolation module¶

cbcrom.empiricalinterpolation.generate_empirical_nodes(reduced_basis)[source]¶

Determine the empirical nodes from the reduced basis.

reduced_basis : List of arraylike objects.
The orthonormalized waveforms making up the reduced basis.
empirical_node_indices : List of integers
Indices for the waveform at the nodes T_i.
cbcrom.empiricalinterpolation.generate_interpolant_list(reduced_basis, empirical_node_indices)[source]¶

Evaluate the TimeSeries B_j(t) that gives the empirical interpolant I_m[h](t) = Sum_{j=1}^m B_j(t) h(T_j) when the the quantities h(T_j) are known.

reduced_basis : List of arraylike objects.
The orthonormalized waveforms making up the reduced basis.
empirical_node_indices : List of integers
Indices corresponding to the nodes [T_0, ..., T_{j-1}].
B_j: List of 1d arrays
The interpolating functions
cbcrom.empiricalinterpolation.generate_new_empirical_node(reduced_basis, empirical_node_indices)[source]¶

Determine the next empirical node from the current empirical nodes and the reduced basis.

reduced_basis : List of arraylike objects.
The orthonormalized waveforms making up the reduced basis.
empirical_node_indices : List of integers
Indices corresponding to the nodes [T_0, ..., T_{j-1}].
imax : int
Index corresponding to the new node T_j.

cbcrom.functionapproximation module¶

cbcrom.functionapproximation.amp_function_generator(param_grid, amp_grid)[source]¶

param_grid : (N+1)d array The N Parameter values at each point on the parameter grid. amp_grid : Nd array Amplitude at each point on the parameter grid.

amp_function(params) : function The amplitude function that passes through the amp_grid data at the points in param_grid.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.amp_function_generator_from_list(param_array, amp_array)[source]¶

Generate a function to fit and/or interpolate the amplitude from a list of values. Parameters ———- param_array : 2d arraylike Array of the parameters at each point in the list. amp_array : array Amplitude at each point in the list.

amp_function(params) : function The amplitude function.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.amp_phase_functions_from_list_at_empirical_nodes(param_array, amp_at_nodes, phase_at_nodes)[source]¶

Generate interpolating functions for amp and phase at each of the empirical_nodes T_i.

param_array : 2d arraylike Array of the parameters at each point in the list. amp_at_nodes : 2d array Amplitude at the empirical_nodes for each set of parameters. phase_at_nodes : 2d array Phase at the empirical_nodes for each set of parameters.

amp_function_list : List of interpolating functions List of interpolating functions for the amplitude at the empirical_nodes. phase_function_list : List of arrays List of interpolating functions for the phase at the empirical_nodes.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.amp_phase_functions_from_uniform_grid_at_empirical_nodes(param_grid, amp_at_nodes_grid, phase_at_nodes_grid)[source]¶

Generate interpolating functions for amp and phase at each of the empirical_nodes T_i.

param_grid : (N+1)d array The N Parameter values at each point on the parameter grid. amp_at_nodes_grid : (N+1)d array Amplitude at the empirical_nodes at each point on the parameter grid. phase_at_nodes_grid : (N+1)d array Phase at the empirical_nodes at each point on the parameter grid.

amp_function_list : List of interpolating functions List of interpolating functions for the amplitude at the empirical_nodes. phase_function_list : List of arrays List of interpolating functions for the phase at the empirical_nodes.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.fit_generator(param_array, data_array, func)[source]¶

Generate a function(params) that fits the data.

param_array : 2d array Parameter values. data_array : 1d array Function values at the corresponding parameter values. func(params, *args) : function to use for the fitting Params is 1d array of parameters. *args are the coefficients.

fit : function(params) A function constructed from func using the best fit parameters.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.phase_function_generator(param_grid, phase_grid)[source]¶

param_grid : (N+1)d array The N Parameter values at each point on the parameter grid. phase_grid : Nd array phase at each point on the parameter grid.

phase_function(params) : function The phase function that passes through the phase_grid data at the points in param_grid.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.phase_function_generator_from_list(param_array, phase_array)[source]¶

Generate a function to fit and/or interpolate the phase from a list of values. Parameters ———- param_array : 2d arraylike Array of the parameters at each point in the list. phase_array : array Phase at each point in the list.

phase_function(params) : function The phase function.

cbcrom.functionapproximation.uniform_grid_interpolation_generator(data, xmin, xmax, order=2)[source]¶

Generate a function of N parameters that interpolates a uniformly spaced Nd array.

data : Nd array Data to interpolate. xmin : 1d array of length N Minimum value of each parameter. xmax : 1d array of length N Maximum value of each parameter.

interp: function(x) Interpolating function that takes x (1d array of the parameter values at which you want to interpolate the data).

cbcrom.functionapproximation.unstructured_linear_interpolation_generator(param_array, data_array, nearest_outside=True)[source]¶

Generate a linear interpolating function(params) from an unstructured grid. This is a wrapper for scipy.interpolate.LinearNDInterpolator.

param_array : 2d array Parameter values. data_array : 1d array Function values at the corresponding parameter values. nearest_outside : {bool, True} Do nearest neighor interpolation outside the convex hull if True. Return nan if False.

interp : function(params) An inteprolating function.

cbcrom.greedy module¶

class cbcrom.greedy.ReducedBasis(add_func, subtract_func, scalar_multiply_func, inner_product_func, get_waveform, ts_params)[source]¶

Functions for generating a set of reduced basis waveforms with the greedy algorithm.

add_func subtract_func scalar_multiply_func inner_product_func get_waveform ts_params norms inner_products sigma_list rb rb_indices rb_params

calculate_norms()[source]¶

Calculate the norms for each waveform in the training set

generate_new_basis_from_specific_waveform(ts_index)[source]¶

Force the next RB waveform to be constructed from the waveform in the training set with the index ts_index.

Also, evaluates the inner product for the remaining training set waveforms, since you will need them for later RB waveforms.

ts_index : int
Index of the training set waveform you want to use.
generate_new_basis_from_training_set()[source]¶

Generate the next RB waveform from the most orthogonal member of the training set.

generate_reduced_basis(epsilon, ts_istart=0, Nbases=None)[source]¶

Generate an orthonormal set of waveforms with the greedy algorithm.

epsilon : float
The tolerance. Should be greater than 1.0e-14.
ts_istart : int
Index for the first RB waveform. 0th waveform in training set by default.
Nbases : int
Maximum number of bases to generate.
generate_reduced_basis_start_with_set(epsilon, ts_initial_list, Nbases=None)[source]¶

Generate an orthonormal set of waveforms with the greedy algorithm. the first waveforms in the RB are constructed from ts_initial_list

epsilon : float
The tolerance. Should be greater than 1.0e-14.
ts_initial_list : int
Indices of the waveforms required to be in the RB.
Nbases : int
Maximum number of bases to generate.
normalize_waveform(h)[source]¶

Normalize the waveform h.

norm : float h_norm : The normalized waveform.

set_initial_rb(ts_index)[source]¶

Set the initial RB waveform to be the one from the training set with index ts_index.

ts_istart : int
Index for the first RB waveform. 0th waveform in training set by default.
cbcrom.greedy.add_basis_with_iterated_modified_gram_schmidt(h, basis, add, subtract, scalar_multiply, inner_product, a=0.5, max_iter=3)[source]¶

Given a function h, find the corresponding basis function orthonormal to all previous ones.

h : waveform
basis : List of orthonormal waveforms
a : int
Parameter to determine if the Gram-Schmidt procedure was made the new basis sufficiently orthogonal
max_iter : int
Number of times to iterate the Gram-Schmidt procedure
cbcrom.greedy.projection(h_new, orthonorm_list, add, scalar_multiply, inner_product)[source]¶

Calculate Proj(h_new) = sum c_i * e_i, where e_i = orthonorm_list[i], and c_i = < hnew | e_i >. This is the projection of a waveform hnew onto a vector space formed by the orthonormal basis orthonorm_list.

orthonorm_list : List of basis vector waveforms.
Set of orthogonal and normalized waveforms.
h_new :
A New waveform.
add : function(h1, h2)
Function that adds two waveforms.
scalar_multiply : function(alpha, h)
Function that multiplies the waveform h by the scalar alpha.
inner_product : function(h1, h2)
Function that evaluates the inner product (scalar) of two waveforms.
proj_onto_span :
Proj(h_new).
cbcrom.greedy.subtract_projection(h_new, orthonorm_list, add, subtract, scalar_multiply, inner_product)[source]¶

Calculate h_new - Proj(h_new): The component of hnew orthogonal to the projection of hnew onto the vector space formed by the orthonormal basis orthonorm_list.

orthonorm_list : List of basis vector waveforms.
Set of orthogonal and normalized waveforms.
h_new :
A New waveform.
add : function(h1, h2)
Function that adds two waveforms.
subtract : function(h1, h2)
Function that subtracts two waveforms (h1-h2).
scalar_multiply : function(alpha, h)
Function that multiplies the waveform h by the scalar alpha.
inner_product : function(h1, h2)
Function that evaluates the inner product (scalar) of two waveforms.
diff :
h_new - Proj(h_new)
